metadata.Title: CVE-2022-20132 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.Description: In lg_probe and related functions of hid-lg.c and other USB HID files, there is a possible out of bounds read due to improper input validation. This could lead to local information disclosure if a malicious USB HID device were plugged in, with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: Android kernelAndroid ID: A-188677105References: Upstream kernel

notes.Note: sbeattie> requires malicious USB devices to be inserted. according to google, the following commits may also be needed, that clean up missing Kconfig dependencies on USB_HID that may cause build failures when incorporating the identified fixing commits: 30cb3c2ad24b66fb7639a6d1f4390c74d6e68f94 d080811f27936f712f619f847389f403ac873b8f f237d9028f844a86955fc9da59d7ac4a5c55d7d5
